title: Project-Based Learning for Data Warehousing for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic database concepts and spreadsheet application skills
context.additional_context: Need to strengthen data analysis competencies for integration with science curricula

learning_goals: Learners explain the data warehouse design process to resolve real data problems in educational settings.
Learners complete an educational dataset construction project by applying the ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) process.

Learners analyze ≥3 science-subject-linked datasets (physics/chemistry/life sciences) using OLAP tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), generate reports with ≥5 visualizations (bar/line/scatter plots), and meet peer/teacher feedback standards (≥4/5-point scale)

Learners analyze real-world elementary education data (student grades, attendance) using ≥3 visualization tools (Google Data Studio, Tableau) and propose ≥2 actionable decision-making strategies for educational improvement
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
